Articles.Content: Thanks for the advice Scr1pt, What I'm happy about is that it actually works in t he essence of not wobbling like a wobbly thing. I never can figure out how people make such structurally integral ships, nevermind those badS wedge shapes, all I know is that you use truss segments for the "backbone" and thats about it... I just want to make something not useless for once.
Does anybody have a fighter or 2 that I can reference for a build of my light - heavy fighters?

I've made a breakthrough! Thanks to ScriptK1tteh, I've managed to create a low part count, deadly (hopefully), and awesome looking Light Destroyer! Weighing in at just 44 tons! Armed with two Jackhammer HVHM Torps and a single 1.25m "Thud" Torpedo (totally not copied from ScriptK1tteh) and a "Dual-Backbone" design, which should hopefully make it more structurally integral. Tests, anyone?

Javascript is disabled. View full album

download Tethys-Class Light Destroyer

Testing is greatly appreciated! Thanks to ScriptK1tteh!

send it over, I'd love to.
OMG Zekes is back!

Anyone wanna test my Light Destroyer?

I do!
It's on Page 408. The Tethys-Class, thanks! If you make any changes, please send me the new download link.

OMG Zekes is back!

My reaction entirely xD

It's on Page 408. The Tethys-Class, thanks! If you make any changes, please send me the new download link.

Peppering it with I-Beam fire is so much fun. It's a nice looking ship, albeit somewhat brittle, but that's to be expected from a light destroyer!

Peppering it with I-Beam fire is so much fun. It's a nice looking ship, albeit somewhat brittle, but that's to be expected from a light destroyer!

http://i.imgur.com/9e7VwGx.png

Yeah, I tested it for a bit, compared it mostly head-to-head with the Squid-Class, as it was only 10 tons difference. It's smaller than a squid, but has three times the range. It likes to wobble a lot (though that may be a bug). I shot I-beams at it and knocked out the engine, shot a Popper at it (overkill, haha)

It's firepower is a bit underwhelming, allthough the SRB will hurt a Squid badly it lacks the "one, two" punch to fully kill one.

I did this a few days ago. Finally.

My Carrier is in orbit and has been refuelled. Ready for acceptance of fighters and amunition.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

After much toil and trouble from the Federation Engineers, we are happy to announce the new Avacyn-class Assault Carrier!

The new Avacyn-class Assault carrier is created to carry two Thalia Fighters into the field and generally to protect them with its gigantic "shield" structure. It doesn't come unarmed though as it comes equipped with 8 anti-capital Mono-prop powered missiles

Download Link

http://i.imgur.com/qms4vQv.png

Yeah, I tested it for a bit, compared it mostly head-to-head with the Squid-Class, as it was only 10 tons difference. It's smaller than a squid, but has three times the range. It likes to wobble a lot (though that may be a bug). I shot I-beams at it and knocked out the engine, shot a Popper at it (overkill, haha)

http://i.imgur.com/LK0Su52.png

It's firepower is a bit underwhelming, allthough the SRB will hurt a Squid badly it lacks the "one, two" punch to fully kill one.

http://i.imgur.com/dDGbMzQ.png

http://i.imgur.com/XFZUe7f.png

Ahah! Alpha said the same with the wobbling and firepower, I will def reduce the reaction wheels (underbelly large RW or the two 1.25m RW) and replace the Jackhammer torps (the small ones) with PosterTorp HVHM's. Thanks for the input as well, Alexander!

- - - Updated - - -

I believe the Tethys is my best ship yet!

I will create a newer ship now to improve upon my Tethys framed ship. I'll show it to you, so you can take a look.

.
